49

Are index funds still the best option in 2025?

With higher rates and volatile markets, does the “buy the index and chill” advice still hold? Any tweaks for different time horizons?

investing index-funds
Jane I
January 12, 2025 at 02:20 AM

2 Answers

Top Answer
48

Yes for most people. Higher rates favor bonds, so a simple tweak is holding your age in high‑quality bonds (or a target‑date fund). Automate monthly buys, rebalance annually, and avoid forecasting. If you want to get fancy, add a small value tilt—historically rewarded, but not required.

Jane I
April 9, 2025 at 08:56 AM
9

The best portfolio is one you can hold through bad years. Keep it boring and automatic.

William F
May 25, 2025 at 05:02 PM
